types.name: CommittableBranch
types.description:
A git ref for a commit to be appended to.

The ref must be a branch, i.e. its fully qualified name must start
with `refs/heads/` (although the input is not required to be fully
qualified).

The Ref may be specified by its global node ID or by the
`repositoryNameWithOwner` and `branchName`.

### Examples

Specify a branch using a global node ID:

    { "id": "MDM6UmVmMTpyZWZzL2hlYWRzL21haW4=" }

Specify a branch using `repositoryNameWithOwner` and `branchName`:

    {
      "repositoryNameWithOwner": "github/graphql-client",
      "branchName": "main"
    }

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The Node ID of the Ref to be updated.

inputFields.name: repositoryNameWithOwner
inputFields.description: The nameWithOwner of the repository to commit to.

inputFields.name: branchName
inputFields.description: The unqualified name of the branch to append the commit to.

fields.description: The first pull request the user opened on GitHub. This will be null if that pull request was opened outside the collection's time range and ignoreTimeRange is not true. If the pull request is not visible but the user has opted to show private contributions, a RestrictedContribution will be returned.

fields.description: The first repository the user created on GitHub. This will be null if that first repository was created outside the collection's time range and ignoreTimeRange is false. If the repository is not visible, then a RestrictedContribution is returned.

fields.description: Determine if the user made any contributions in this time frame whose details are not visible because they were made in a private repository. Can only be true if the user enabled private contribution counts.

inputFields.name: sponsorableLogin
inputFields.description: The username of the organization to create a GitHub Sponsors profile for, if desired. Defaults to creating a GitHub Sponsors profile for the authenticated user if omitted.

inputFields.name: fiscalHostLogin
inputFields.description: The username of the supported fiscal host's GitHub organization, if you want to receive sponsorship payouts through a fiscal host rather than directly to a bank account. For example, 'Open-Source-Collective' for Open Source Collective or 'numfocus' for numFOCUS. Case insensitive. See https://docs.github.com/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-through-github-sponsors/using-a-fiscal-host-to-receive-github-sponsors-payouts for more information.

inputFields.name: fiscallyHostedProjectProfileUrl
inputFields.description: The URL for your profile page on the fiscal host's website, e.g., https://opencollective.com/babel or https://numfocus.org/project/bokeh. Required if fiscalHostLogin is specified.

inputFields.name: billingCountryOrRegionCode
inputFields.description: The country or region where the sponsorable's bank account is located. Required if fiscalHostLogin is not specified, ignored when fiscalHostLogin is specified.

inputFields.name: residenceCountryOrRegionCode
inputFields.description: The country or region where the sponsorable resides. This is for tax purposes. Required if the sponsorable is yourself, ignored when sponsorableLogin specifies an organization.

inputFields.name: contactEmail
inputFields.description: The email address we should use to contact you about the GitHub Sponsors profile being created. This will not be shared publicly. Must be a verified email address already on your GitHub account. Only relevant when the sponsorable is yourself. Defaults to your primary email address on file if omitted.

inputFields.name: fullDescription
inputFields.description: Provide an introduction to serve as the main focus that appears on your GitHub Sponsors profile. It's a great opportunity to help potential sponsors learn more about you, your work, and why their sponsorship is important to you. GitHub-flavored Markdown is supported.

inputFields.description: A unique identifier for the client performing the mutation.

inputFields.name: sponsorableId
inputFields.description: The ID of the user or organization who owns the GitHub Sponsors profile. Defaults to the current user if omitted and sponsorableLogin is not given.

inputFields.name: sponsorableLogin
inputFields.description: The username of the user or organization who owns the GitHub Sponsors profile. Defaults to the current user if omitted and sponsorableId is not given.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The value of the new tier in US dollars. Valid values: 1-12000.

inputFields.name: isRecurring
inputFields.description: Whether sponsorships using this tier should happen monthly/yearly or just once.

inputFields.name: repositoryId
inputFields.description: Optional ID of the private repository that sponsors at this tier should gain read-only access to. Must be owned by an organization.

inputFields.name: repositoryOwnerLogin
inputFields.description: Optional login of the organization owner of the private repository that sponsors at this tier should gain read-only access to. Necessary if repositoryName is given. Will be ignored if repositoryId is given.

inputFields.name: repositoryName
inputFields.description: Optional name of the private repository that sponsors at this tier should gain read-only access to. Must be owned by an organization. Necessary if repositoryOwnerLogin is given. Will be ignored if repositoryId is given.

inputFields.name: welcomeMessage
inputFields.description: Optional message new sponsors at this tier will receive.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: A description of what this tier is, what perks sponsors might receive, what a sponsorship at this tier means for you, etc.

inputFields.name: publish
inputFields.description: Whether to make the tier available immediately for sponsors to choose. Defaults to creating a draft tier that will not be publicly visible.

inputFields.description: The ID of one of sponsorable's existing tiers to sponsor at. Required if amount is not specified.

inputFields.name: isRecurring
inputFields.description: Whether the sponsorship should happen monthly/yearly or just this one time. Required if a tierId is not specified.

inputFields.name: receiveEmails
inputFields.description: Whether the sponsor should receive email updates from the sponsorable.

inputFields.name: privacyLevel
inputFields.description: Specify whether others should be able to see that the sponsor is sponsoring the sponsorable. Public visibility still does not reveal which tier is used.

types.name: ExternalIdentity
types.description: An external identity provisioned by SAML SSO or SCIM. If SAML is configured on the organization, the external identity is visible to (1) organization owners, (2) organization owners' personal access tokens (classic) with read:org or admin:org scope, (3) GitHub App with an installation token with read or write access to members. If SAML is configured on the enterprise, the external identity is visible to (1) enterprise owners, (2) enterprise owners' personal access tokens (classic) with read:enterprise or admin:enterprise scope.

types.name: GitSignatureState
types.description: The state of a Git signature.

enumValues.name: VALID
enumValues.description: Valid signature and verified by GitHub

enumValues.name: INVALID
enumValues.description: Invalid signature

enumValues.name: MALFORMED_SIG
enumValues.description: Malformed signature

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN_KEY
enumValues.description: Key used for signing not known to GitHub

enumValues.name: BAD_EMAIL
enumValues.description: Invalid email used for signing

enumValues.name: UNVERIFIED_EMAIL
enumValues.description: Email used for signing unverified on GitHub

enumValues.name: NO_USER
enumValues.description: Email used for signing not known to GitHub

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN_SIG_TYPE
enumValues.description: Unknown signature type

enumValues.name: UNSIGNED
enumValues.description: Unsigned

enumValues.name: GPGVERIFY_UNAVAILABLE
enumValues.description: Internal error - the GPG verification service is unavailable at the moment

enumValues.name: GPGVERIFY_ERROR
enumValues.description: Internal error - the GPG verification service misbehaved

enumValues.name: NOT_SIGNING_KEY
enumValues.description: The usage flags for the key that signed this don't allow signing

enumValues.name: EXPIRED_KEY
enumValues.description: Signing key expired

enumValues.name: OCSP_PENDING
enumValues.description: Valid signature, pending certificate revocation checking

enumValues.name: OCSP_ERROR
enumValues.description: Valid signature, though certificate revocation check failed

enumValues.name: BAD_CERT
enumValues.description: The signing certificate or its chain could not be verified

enumValues.name: OCSP_REVOKED
enumValues.description: One or more certificates in chain has been revoked

types.name: ID
types.description: Represents a unique identifier that is Base64 obfuscated. It is often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"VXNlci0xMA=="`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: MergeQueueEntryState
types.description: The possible states for a merge queue entry.

enumValues.name: QUEUED
enumValues.description: The entry is currently queued.

enumValues.name: AWAITING_CHECKS
enumValues.description: The entry is currently waiting for checks to pass.

enumValues.name: MERGEABLE
enumValues.description: The entry is currently mergeable.

enumValues.name: UNMERGEABLE
enumValues.description: The entry is currently unmergeable.

enumValues.name: LOCKED
enumValues.description: The entry is currently locked.

types.name: MergeQueueGroupingStrategy
types.description: When set to ALLGREEN, the merge commit created by merge queue for each PR in the group must pass all required checks to merge. When set to HEADGREEN, only the commit at the head of the merge group, i.e. the commit containing changes from all of the PRs in the group, must pass its required checks to merge.

enumValues.name: ALLGREEN
enumValues.description: The merge commit created by merge queue for each PR in the group must pass all required checks to merge

enumValues.name: HEADGREEN
enumValues.description: Only the commit at the head of the merge group must pass its required checks to merge.

types.name: MergeQueueMergeMethod
types.description: Method to use when merging changes from queued pull requests.

enumValues.name: MERGE
enumValues.description: Merge commit

enumValues.name: SQUASH
enumValues.description: Squash and merge

enumValues.name: REBASE
enumValues.description: Rebase and merge

types.name: MergeQueueMergingStrategy
types.description: The possible merging strategies for a merge queue.

enumValues.name: ALLGREEN
enumValues.description: Entries only allowed to merge if they are passing.

enumValues.name: HEADGREEN
enumValues.description: Failing Entires are allowed to merge if they are with a passing entry.

types.name: MergeQueueParameters
types.description: Merges must be performed via a merge queue.

fields.name: checkResponseTimeoutMinutes
fields.description: Maximum time for a required status check to report a conclusion. After this much time has elapsed, checks that have not reported a conclusion will be assumed to have failed

fields.name: groupingStrategy
fields.description: When set to ALLGREEN, the merge commit created by merge queue for each PR in the group must pass all required checks to merge. When set to HEADGREEN, only the commit at the head of the merge group, i.e. the commit containing changes from all of the PRs in the group, must pass its required checks to merge.

fields.name: maxEntriesToBuild
fields.description: Limit the number of queued pull requests requesting checks and workflow runs at the same time.

fields.name: maxEntriesToMerge
fields.description: The maximum number of PRs that will be merged together in a group.

fields.name: mergeMethod
fields.description: Method to use when merging changes from queued pull requests.

fields.name: minEntriesToMerge
fields.description: The minimum number of PRs that will be merged together in a group.

fields.name: minEntriesToMergeWaitMinutes
fields.description: The time merge queue should wait after the first PR is added to the queue for the minimum group size to be met. After this time has elapsed, the minimum group size will be ignored and a smaller group will be merged.

types.name: MergeStateStatus

enumValues.name: DIRTY
enumValues.description: The merge commit cannot be cleanly created.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: The state cannot currently be determined.

enumValues.name: BLOCKED
enumValues.description: The merge is blocked.

enumValues.name: BEHIND

enumValues.name: DRAFT
enumValues.description: The merge is blocked due to the pull request being a draft.

enumValues.description: Mergeable with non-passing commit status.

enumValues.name: HAS_HOOKS
enumValues.description: Mergeable with passing commit status and pre-receive hooks.

enumValues.name: CLEAN
enumValues.description: Mergeable and passing commit status.

enumValues.name: CONFLICTING

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: The mergeability of the pull request is still being calculated.

fields.name: createCommitOnBranch
fields.description:
Appends a commit to the given branch as the authenticated user.

This mutation creates a commit whose parent is the HEAD of the provided
branch and also updates that branch to point to the new commit.
It can be thought of as similar to `git commit`.

### Locating a Branch

Commits are appended to a `branch` of type `Ref`.
This must refer to a git branch (i.e.  the fully qualified path must
begin with `refs/heads/`, although including this prefix is optional.

Callers may specify the `branch` to commit to either by its global node
ID or by passing both of `repositoryNameWithOwner` and `refName`.  For
more details see the documentation for `CommittableBranch`.

### Describing Changes

`fileChanges` are specified as a `FilesChanges` object describing
`FileAdditions` and `FileDeletions`.

Please see the documentation for `FileChanges` for more information on
how to use this argument to describe any set of file changes.

### Authorship

Similar to the web commit interface, this mutation does not support
specifying the author or committer of the commit and will not add
support for this in the future.

A commit created by a successful execution of this mutation will be
authored by the owner of the credential which authenticates the API
request.  The committer will be identical to that of commits authored
using the web interface.

If you need full control over author and committer information, please
use the Git Database REST API instead.

### Commit Signing

Commits made using this mutation are automatically signed by GitHub if
supported and will be marked as verified in the user interface.

args.name: input
args.description: Parameters for CreateCommitOnBranch

fields.name: updateRef
fields.description: Update a Git Ref.

args.name: input
args.description: Parameters for UpdateRef

fields.name: updateRefs
fields.description:
Creates, updates and/or deletes multiple refs in a repository.

This mutation takes a list of `RefUpdate`s and performs these updates
on the repository. All updates are performed atomically, meaning that
if one of them is rejected, no other ref will be modified.

`RefUpdate.beforeOid` specifies that the given reference needs to point
to the given value before performing any updates. A value of
`0000000000000000000000000000000000000000` can be used to verify that
the references should not exist.

`RefUpdate.afterOid` specifies the value that the given reference
will point to after performing all updates. A value of
`0000000000000000000000000000000000000000` can be used to delete a
reference.

If `RefUpdate.force` is set to `true`, a non-fast-forward updates
for the given reference will be allowed.

args.name: input
args.description: Parameters for UpdateRefs

types.name: NotificationReason
types.description: The reason you received a notification about a subject.

enumValues.name: ASSIGN
enumValues.description: You were assigned to the Issue/PR.

enumValues.name: AUTHOR
enumValues.description: You created the thread.

enumValues.name: COMMENT
enumValues.description: You commented on the thread.

enumValues.name: INVITATION
enumValues.description: You accepted an invitation to contribute to the repository.

enumValues.name: MANUAL
enumValues.description: You subscribed to the thread (via an Issue or Pull Request).

enumValues.name: MENTION
enumValues.description: You were specifically @mentioned in the content.

enumValues.name: REVIEW_REQUESTED
enumValues.description: You were requested for review.

enumValues.name: SECURITY_ADVISORY_CREDIT
enumValues.description: You were given credit for contributing to a Security Advisory.

enumValues.name: SECURITY_ALERT
enumValues.description: You have access to the notification subject's Dependabot alerts.

enumValues.name: STATE_CHANGE
enumValues.description: You changed the thread state (for example, closing an Issue or merging a Pull Request).

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIBED
enumValues.description: You are watching the subject of the notification.

enumValues.name: TEAM_MENTION
enumValues.description: You were on a team that was mentioned.

enumValues.name: CI_ACTIVITY
enumValues.description: You are subscribed to continuous integration activity.

enumValues.name: APPROVAL_REQUESTED
enumValues.description: You were requested for review for deployment.

enumValues.name: SAVED
enumValues.description: You saved this notification

enumValues.name: READY_FOR_REVIEW
enumValues.description: A pull request you're subscribed to was marked ready for review.

enumValues.name: MEMBER_FEATURE_REQUESTED
enumValues.description: New requests from members.

types.name: NotificationRestrictionSettingValue
types.description: The possible values for the notification restriction setting.

enumValues.name: ENABLED
enumValues.description: The setting is enabled for the owner.

enumValues.name: DISABLED
enumValues.description: The setting is disabled for the owner.

types.name: NotificationStatus
types.description: The possible states of a notification.

enumValues.name: READ
enumValues.description: A notification is read

enumValues.name: UNREAD
enumValues.description: A notification is unread

enumValues.name: ARCHIVED
enumValues.description: A notification is archived

enumValues.name: DONE
enumValues.description: A notification is done

types.name: NotificationThreadFilters
types.description: Ways in which to filter lists of notification threads.

inputFields.name: statuses

inputFields.name: reasons

inputFields.name: listIds
inputFields.description: Only return notification threads where the list is in the given list

inputFields.name: starredOnly
inputFields.description: Only return starred notifications. All other filters will be ignored.

inputFields.name: savedOnly

inputFields.name: threadTypes
inputFields.description: Only return matching thread types

enumValues.name: UNSUBSCRIBED
enumValues.description: The thread is not subscribed to.

types.name: OrgRemoveMemberAuditEntryMembershipType
types.description: The type of membership a user has with an Organization.

enumValues.name: SUSPENDED
enumValues.description: A suspended member.

enumValues.name: DIRECT_MEMBER
enumValues.description: A direct member is a user that is a member of the Organization.

enumValues.name: ADMIN
enumValues.description: Organization owners have full access and can change several settings, including the names of repositories that belong to the Organization and Owners team membership. In addition, organization owners can delete the organization and all of its repositories.

enumValues.name: BILLING_MANAGER
enumValues.description: A billing manager is a user who manages the billing settings for the Organization, such as updating payment information.

enumValues.name: UNAFFILIATED
enumValues.description: An unaffiliated collaborator is a person who is not a member of the Organization and does not have access to any repositories in the Organization.

enumValues.name: OUTSIDE_COLLABORATOR
enumValues.description: An outside collaborator is a person who isn't explicitly a member of the Organization, but who has Read, Write, or Admin permissions to one or more repositories in the organization.

types.name: OrgRemoveMemberAuditEntryReason
types.description: The reason a member was removed from an Organization.

enumValues.name: TWO_FACTOR_REQUIREMENT_NON_COMPLIANCE
enumValues.description: The organization required 2FA of its billing managers and this user did not have 2FA enabled.

enumValues.name: SAML_EXTERNAL_IDENTITY_MISSING
enumValues.description: SAML external identity missing

enumValues.name: SAML_SSO_ENFORCEMENT_REQUIRES_EXTERNAL_IDENTITY
enumValues.description: SAML SSO enforcement requires an external identity

enumValues.name: USER_ACCOUNT_DELETED
enumValues.description: User account has been deleted

enumValues.name: TWO_FACTOR_ACCOUNT_RECOVERY
enumValues.description: User was removed from organization during account recovery

enumValues.description: All organization members are restricted from creating private or internal repositories.

types.name: RepoChangeMergeSettingAuditEntryMergeType
types.description: The merge options available for pull requests to this repository.

enumValues.name: MERGE
enumValues.description: The pull request is added to the base branch in a merge commit.

enumValues.name: REBASE
enumValues.description: Commits from the pull request are added onto the base branch individually without a merge commit.

enumValues.name: SQUASH
enumValues.description: The pull request's commits are squashed into a single commit before they are merged to the base branch.

types.description: Properties by which repository rule connections can be ordered.

enumValues.name: UPDATED_AT
enumValues.description: Order repository rules by updated time

enumValues.name: CREATED_AT
enumValues.description: Order repository rules by created time

enumValues.name: TYPE
enumValues.description: Order repository rules by type

types.name: RepositoryRuleType
types.description: The rule types supported in rulesets

enumValues.name: CREATION
enumValues.description: Only allow users with bypass permission to create matching refs.

enumValues.name: UPDATE
enumValues.description: Only allow users with bypass permission to update matching refs.

enumValues.name: DELETION
enumValues.description: Only allow users with bypass permissions to delete matching refs.

enumValues.name: REQUIRED_LINEAR_HISTORY
enumValues.description: Prevent merge commits from being pushed to matching refs.

enumValues.name: MERGE_QUEUE
enumValues.description: Merges must be performed via a merge queue.

enumValues.name: REQUIRED_REVIEW_THREAD_RESOLUTION
enumValues.description: When enabled, all conversations on code must be resolved before a pull request can be merged into a branch that matches this rule.

enumValues.name: REQUIRED_DEPLOYMENTS
enumValues.description: Choose which environments must be successfully deployed to before refs can be pushed into a ref that matches this rule.

enumValues.name: REQUIRED_SIGNATURES
enumValues.description: Commits pushed to matching refs must have verified signatures.

enumValues.name: PULL_REQUEST
enumValues.description: Require all commits be made to a non-target branch and submitted via a pull request before they can be merged.

enumValues.name: REQUIRED_STATUS_CHECKS
enumValues.description: Choose which status checks must pass before the ref is updated. When enabled, commits must first be pushed to another ref where the checks pass.

enumValues.name: REQUIRED_WORKFLOW_STATUS_CHECKS
enumValues.description: Require all commits be made to a non-target branch and submitted via a pull request and required workflow checks to pass before they can be merged.

enumValues.name: NON_FAST_FORWARD
enumValues.description: Prevent users with push access from force pushing to refs.

enumValues.name: AUTHORIZATION
enumValues.description: Authorization

enumValues.name: TAG
enumValues.description: Tag

enumValues.name: MERGE_QUEUE_LOCKED_REF
enumValues.description: Merge queue locked ref

enumValues.name: LOCK_BRANCH
enumValues.description: Branch is read-only. Users cannot push to the branch.

enumValues.name: MAX_REF_UPDATES
enumValues.description: Max ref updates

enumValues.name: COMMIT_MESSAGE_PATTERN
enumValues.description: Commit message pattern

enumValues.name: COMMIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL_PATTERN
enumValues.description: Commit author email pattern

enumValues.name: COMMITTER_EMAIL_PATTERN
enumValues.description: Committer email pattern

enumValues.name: BRANCH_NAME_PATTERN
enumValues.description: Branch name pattern

enumValues.name: TAG_NAME_PATTERN
enumValues.description: Tag name pattern

enumValues.name: FILE_PATH_RESTRICTION
enumValues.description: Prevent commits that include changes in specified file and folder paths from being pushed to the commit graph. This includes absolute paths that contain file names.

enumValues.name: MAX_FILE_PATH_LENGTH
enumValues.description: Prevent commits that include file paths that exceed the specified character limit from being pushed to the commit graph.

enumValues.name: FILE_EXTENSION_RESTRICTION
enumValues.description: Prevent commits that include files with specified file extensions from being pushed to the commit graph.

enumValues.name: MAX_FILE_SIZE
enumValues.description: Prevent commits with individual files that exceed the specified limit from being pushed to the commit graph.

enumValues.name: WORKFLOWS
enumValues.description: Require all changes made to a targeted branch to pass the specified workflows before they can be merged.

enumValues.name: SECRET_SCANNING
enumValues.description: Secret scanning

enumValues.name: WORKFLOW_UPDATES
enumValues.description: Workflow files cannot be modified.

enumValues.name: CODE_SCANNING
enumValues.description: Choose which tools must provide code scanning results before the reference is updated. When configured, code scanning must be enabled and have results for both the commit and the reference being updated.

enumValues.name: COPILOT_CODE_REVIEW
enumValues.description: Request Copilot code review for new pull requests automatically if the author has access to Copilot code review and their premium requests quota has not reached the limit.

fields.description: When the vulnerability was last updated

fields.name: vulnerableVersionRange
fields.description:
A string that describes the vulnerable package versions.
This string follows a basic syntax with a few forms.
+ `= 0.2.0` denotes a single vulnerable version.
+ `<= 1.0.8` denotes a version range up to and including the specified version
+ `< 0.1.11` denotes a version range up to, but excluding, the specified version
+ `>= 4.3.0, < 4.3.5` denotes a version range with a known minimum and maximum version.
+ `>= 0.0.1` denotes a version range with a known minimum, but no known maximum

types.name: SponsorsGoal
types.description: A goal associated with a GitHub Sponsors listing, representing a target the sponsored maintainer would like to attain.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of the goal from the maintainer.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: What the objective of this goal is.

fields.name: percentComplete
fields.description: The percentage representing how complete this goal is, between 0-100.

fields.name: targetValue
fields.description: What the goal amount is. Represents an amount in USD for monthly sponsorship amount goals. Represents a count of unique sponsors for total sponsors count goals.

fields.name: title
fields.description: A brief summary of the kind and target value of this goal.

types.name: SponsorsGoalKind
types.description: The different kinds of goals a GitHub Sponsors member can have.

enumValues.name: TOTAL_SPONSORS_COUNT
enumValues.description: The goal is about reaching a certain number of sponsors.

enumValues.name: MONTHLY_SPONSORSHIP_AMOUNT
enumValues.description: The goal is about getting a certain amount in USD from sponsorships each month.

fields.name: activeGoal
fields.description: The current goal the maintainer is trying to reach with GitHub Sponsors, if any.

fields.name: activeStripeConnectAccount
fields.description: The Stripe Connect account currently in use for payouts for this Sponsors listing, if any. Will only return a value when queried by the maintainer themselves, or by an admin of the sponsorable organization.

fields.name: billingCountryOrRegion
fields.description: The name of the country or region with the maintainer's bank account or fiscal host. Will only return a value when queried by the maintainer themselves, or by an admin of the sponsorable organization.

fields.name: contactEmailAddress
fields.description: The email address used by GitHub to contact the sponsorable about their GitHub Sponsors profile. Will only return a value when queried by the maintainer themselves, or by an admin of the sponsorable organization.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Identifies the date and time when the object was created.

fields.name: dashboardResourcePath
fields.description: The HTTP path for the Sponsors dashboard for this Sponsors listing.

fields.name: dashboardUrl
fields.description: The HTTP URL for the Sponsors dashboard for this Sponsors listing.

fields.name: featuredItems
fields.description: The records featured on the GitHub Sponsors profile.

args.name: featureableTypes
args.description: The types of featured items to return.

fields.name: fiscalHost
fields.description: The fiscal host used for payments, if any. Will only return a value when queried by the maintainer themselves, or by an admin of the sponsorable organization.

fields.name: fullDescription
fields.description: The full description of the listing.

fields.name: fullDescriptionHTML
fields.description: The full description of the listing rendered to HTML.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The Node ID of the SponsorsListing object

fields.name: isPublic
fields.description: Whether this listing is publicly visible.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The listing's full name.

fields.name: nextPayoutDate
fields.description: A future date on which this listing is eligible to receive a payout.

fields.name: residenceCountryOrRegion
fields.description: The name of the country or region where the maintainer resides. Will only return a value when queried by the maintainer themselves, or by an admin of the sponsorable organization.

fields.name: resourcePath
fields.description: The HTTP path for this Sponsors listing.

fields.name: shortDescription
fields.description: The short description of the listing.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The short name of the listing.

fields.name: sponsorable
fields.description: The entity this listing represents who can be sponsored on GitHub Sponsors.

fields.name: tiers
fields.description: The tiers for this GitHub Sponsors profile.

args.description: Ordering options for Sponsors tiers returned from the connection.

args.name: includeUnpublished
args.description: Whether to include tiers that aren't published. Only admins of the Sponsors listing can see draft tiers. Only admins of the Sponsors listing and viewers who are currently sponsoring on a retired tier can see those retired tiers. Defaults to including only published tiers, which are visible to anyone who can see the GitHub Sponsors profile.

fields.name: createdAt

fields.name: description

fields.name: featureable
fields.description: The record that is featured on the GitHub Sponsors profile.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The Node ID of the SponsorsListingFeaturedItem object

fields.name: position
fields.description: The position of this featured item on the GitHub Sponsors profile with a lower position indicating higher precedence. Starts at 1.

fields.name: sponsorsListing
fields.description: The GitHub Sponsors profile that features this record.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Identifies the date and time when the object was last updated.

types.name: SponsorsListingFeaturedItemFeatureableType
types.description: The different kinds of records that can be featured on a GitHub Sponsors profile page.

enumValues.name: REPOSITORY

enumValues.name: USER

types.name: SponsorsTier
types.description: A GitHub Sponsors tier associated with a GitHub Sponsors listing.

fields.name: adminInfo
fields.description: SponsorsTier information only visible to users that can administer the associated Sponsors listing.

fields.name: closestLesserValueTier
fields.description: Get a different tier for this tier's maintainer that is at the same frequency as this tier but with an equal or lesser cost. Returns the published tier with the monthly price closest to this tier's without going over.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Identifies the date and time when the object was created.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the tier.

fields.name: descriptionHTML
fields.description: The tier description rendered to HTML

fields.name: id
fields.description: The Node ID of the SponsorsTier object

fields.name: isCustomAmount
fields.description: Whether this tier was chosen at checkout time by the sponsor rather than defined ahead of time by the maintainer who manages the Sponsors listing.

fields.name: isOneTime
fields.description: Whether this tier is only for use with one-time sponsorships.

fields.name: monthlyPriceInCents
fields.description: How much this tier costs per month in cents.

fields.name: monthlyPriceInDollars
fields.description: How much this tier costs per month in USD.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the tier.

fields.name: sponsorsListing
fields.description: The sponsors listing that this tier belongs to.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Identifies the date and time when the object was last updated.

types.name: SponsorsTierAdminInfo
types.description: SponsorsTier information only visible to users that can administer the associated Sponsors listing.

fields.name: isDraft
fields.description: Indicates whether this tier is still a work in progress by the sponsorable and not yet published to the associated GitHub Sponsors profile. Draft tiers cannot be used for new sponsorships and will not be in use on existing sponsorships. Draft tiers cannot be seen by anyone but the admins of the GitHub Sponsors profile.

fields.name: isPublished
fields.description: Indicates whether this tier is published to the associated GitHub Sponsors profile. Published tiers are visible to anyone who can see the GitHub Sponsors profile, and are available for use in sponsorships if the GitHub Sponsors profile is publicly visible.

fields.name: isRetired
fields.description: Indicates whether this tier has been retired from the associated GitHub Sponsors profile. Retired tiers are no longer shown on the GitHub Sponsors profile and cannot be chosen for new sponsorships. Existing sponsorships may still use retired tiers if the sponsor selected the tier before it was retired.

fields.name: sponsorships
fields.description: The sponsorships using this tier.

enumValues.description: Order team members by login

enumValues.name: CREATED_AT
enumValues.description: Order team members by creation time

types.name: TeamMemberRole
types.description: The possible team member roles; either 'maintainer' or 'member'.

enumValues.name: MAINTAINER
enumValues.description: A team maintainer has permission to add and remove team members.

enumValues.name: MEMBER
enumValues.description: A team member has no administrative permissions on the team.

types.name: TeamMembershipType
types.description: Defines which types of team members are included in the returned list. Can be one of IMMEDIATE, CHILD_TEAM or ALL.

enumValues.name: IMMEDIATE
enumValues.description: Includes only immediate members of the team.

enumValues.name: CHILD_TEAM
enumValues.description: Includes only child team members for the team.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: Includes immediate and child team members for the team.

enumValues.name: NOTIFICATIONS_ENABLED
enumValues.description: Everyone will receive notifications when the team is @mentioned.

enumValues.name: NOTIFICATIONS_DISABLED
enumValues.description: No one will receive notifications.

enumValues.name: NAME
enumValues.description: Allows ordering a list of teams by name.

enumValues.name: SECRET
enumValues.description: A secret team can only be seen by its members.

enumValues.name: VISIBLE
enumValues.description: A visible team can be seen and @mentioned by every member of the organization.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

fields.name: onField
fields.deprecationReason: Use `locations`.

fields.name: onFragment
fields.deprecationReason: Use `locations`.

fields.name: onOperation
fields.deprecationReason: Use `locations`.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Requires that exactly one field must be supplied and that field must not be `null`.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
